tweezer.core.overview module¶

tweezer.core.parallel module¶

A program that reads integer values from a CSV file and writes out their sums to another CSV file, using multiple processes if desired.

class tweezer.core.parallel.CSVWorker(numprocs, infile, outfile)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Methods

parse_input_csv()[source]¶

Parses the input CSV and yields tuples with the index of the row as the first element, and the integers of the row as the second element.

The index is zero-index based.

The data is then sent over inqueue for the workers to do their thing. At the end the input thread sends a ‘STOP’ message for each worker.

sum_row()[source]¶

Workers. Consume inq and produce answers on outq

write_output_csv()[source]¶

Open outgoing csv file then start reading outq for answers Since I chose to make sure output was synchronized to the input there is some extra goodies to do that.

Obviously your input has the original row number so this is not required.

tweezer.core.polymer module¶

class tweezer.core.polymer.ExtensibleWormLikeChain(contour_length, persistence_length=50, stretch_modulus=1200, temperature=295)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Extensible WLC Model according to Odijk, T. Stiff chains and filaments under tension. Macromolecules (1995).

X(F; L, Lp, S) = L(1 - 1/2*sqrt(kT/F*Lp) + F/S)

Attributes

Methods

Contour length of the polymer in the worm like chain model

P[source]¶

Stretch modulus of the worm-like chain model in pN

class tweezer.core.polymer.LengthDependentPersistenceLength(persistence_length_infinity=50, a=4)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Implements the empirical length-dependent persistence length formula of:

Ribezzi-Crivellari, M. & Ritort, F. Force Spectroscopy with Dual-Trap Optical Tweezers: Molecular Stiffness Measurements and Coupled Fluctuations Analysis. Biophys J (2012).

Paper Link

Parameter:
L - contour_length of semiflexible polymer (unit: nm) P_inf - projected persistence length for infinitely long polymer a - configuration-dependent unit-less parameter

Methods

Bases: builtins.object

tweezer.core.trap module¶

Trap¶

Routines, classes and functions related to optical traps.

tweezer.core.trap_calibration module¶

Contains classes and functions related to the calibration of forces in an optical trap

class tweezer.core.trap_calibration.SingleTrapPowerSpectrum(diffusion_coefficient, corner_frequency=500)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Analytic form for fitting the power spectrum of a microsphere trapped in a single optical trap

Parameter:
D - diffusion_coefficient (µm^2 / s) fc - corner_frequency (500 Hz)
Methods:
constructor(L, P, S, T): set parameter (with default values) power_spectrum(frequency): compute the extension at a certain force formula(): print out formula used

Methods

tweezer.core.watcher module¶

Monitors a tweezer directory for file changing events

class tweezer.core.watcher.ChangeHandler[source]¶

Bases: watchdog.events.FileSystemEventHandler

Reacts to changes on the file system and dispatches the appropriate methods for the registered file system event.

Methods

If any file or directory is on_created

tweezer.core.watcher.build_docs()[source]¶

Run the Sphinx build (make html) to make sure we have the latest version of the docs

Use call here so that we don’t detect file changes while this is running...

Finds all files in a list that matches a certain pattern.

tweezer.core.watcher.run_unittests()[source]¶

Run unit tests with unittest.

tweezer.core.watcher.run_watcher(directory)[source]¶

Called when run as main() from the command line. Looks for changes to the file system. Can be stopped with CTRL+C.

Module contents¶

Contains core modules and classes for analysing tweezer experiments.
